caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 61–63.
Austroterobia partiviridis
: 61, holotype ♀, habitus, lateral view; 62, holotype ♀, habitus, dorsal view; 63, allotype ♂, habitus, lateral view.

FIGURES 64–71.
Austroterobia partiviridis
: 64, holotype ♀, head, frontal view; 65, holotype ♀, head, dorsal view; 66, holotype ♀, head, lateral view; 67, allotype ♂, antennae; 68, paratype ♀, mesosoma, dorsal view; 69, holotype ♀, mesosoma, lateral view; 70, paratype ♀, propodeum and petiole, dorsal view; 71, holotype ♀, fore wing.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. A male identified as
A . partibrunnea
by Z. Bouček has the mesosoma dorsally distinctly metallic green. This specimen also has a darker gaster, orange-brown basally and dark brown distally. However, it has all the other characters of the new species, so it is included in the type series. One female specimen lacking its head is excluded from the type series.
Etymology. The specific epithet indicates that in this species only the head is metallic green.
